Chinese.title: Kung Pao Chicken
Chinese.instructions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, rice wine, and cornstarch for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a wok and stir-fry chicken until golden. Remove and set aside. In the same wok, stir-fry garlic, ginger, and chilies until fragrant. Add bell peppers and cook for 2 minutes. Return chicken to wok, add hoisin sauce and peanuts. Stir-fry for 2 minutes until everything is well combined and heated through.

Chinese.title: Mapo Tofu
Chinese.instructions: Heat oil in a wok and brown ground pork until crispy. Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger, stir-frying for 1 minute. Add chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Gently add tofu cubes and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with soy sauce and rice wine. Garnish with green onions and Sichuan peppercorns. Serve hot over steamed rice.

Chinese.title: Peking Duck
Chinese.instructions: Clean and dry the duck thoroughly. Mix honey, soy sauce, rice wine, ginger, and five-spice powder. Brush mixture over duck and let air-dry for 4 hours. Roast duck at 350°F for 2 hours, basting every 30 minutes. Increase temperature to 400°F for final 15 minutes to crisp skin. Carve duck and serve with hoisin sauce, cucumber, green onions, and pancakes.

Chinese.title: Dim Sum Dumplings
Chinese.instructions: Mix flour with hot water to form a dough. Knead for 10 minutes, cover and rest for 30 minutes. For filling, combine shrimp, pork, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and cabbage. Roll dough into small circles. Place filling in center and pleat edges to seal. Steam dumplings for 8-10 minutes until cooked through.

Chinese.title: Sweet and Sour Pork
Chinese.instructions: Coat pork cubes with cornstarch and beaten egg. Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy. Remove and drain. In a wok, stir-fry bell pepper and onion for 2 minutes. Add pineapple, ketchup, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar. Cook until sauce thickens. Return pork to wok and toss to coat. Serve hot.

Chinese.title: Beef and Broccoli
Chinese.instructions: Marinate beef with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch for 20 minutes. Blanch broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, then shock in ice water. Heat oil in wok and stir-fry beef until browned. Remove and set aside. Stir-fry garlic and ginger, add broccoli and beef stock. Return beef to wok and stir-fry for 2 minutes until heated through.

Chinese.title: Egg Fried Rice
Chinese.instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Scramble eggs and remove from wok. Add more oil and stir-fry rice, breaking up any clumps. Add peas and carrots, stir-frying for 2 minutes. Return eggs to wok, add soy sauce and sesame oil. Stir-fry for 1 minute until everything is well combined and heated through.

Chinese.title: Hot and Sour Soup
Chinese.instructions: Bring chicken stock to a boil in a large pot. Add bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and tofu. Simmer for 10 minutes. Mix cornstarch with water and stir into soup to thicken. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili oil, and white pepper. Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into soup while stirring. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Chinese.title: Char Siu Pork
Chinese.instructions: Mix all ingredients except pork to make marinade. Coat pork with marinade and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350°F. Place pork on a rack in a roasting pan and roast for 1.5 hours, basting with marinade every 20 minutes. Increase temperature to 400°F for final 10 minutes to caramelize. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Chinese.title: Wonton Soup
Chinese.instructions: Mix pork, shrimp, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper for filling. Place small amount of filling in center of wonton wrapper. Moisten edges with water and fold to seal. Bring chicken stock to a boil. Add wontons and cook for 5 minutes. Add bok choy and cook for 2 minutes. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Japanese.title: Sushi Roll California
Japanese.instructions: Cook sushi rice and mix with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Let cool to room temperature. Mix crab with mayonnaise and sriracha. Place nori sheet on bamboo mat. Spread rice evenly over nori, leaving 1 inch at top. Place avocado, cucumber, and crab mixture in center. Roll tightly using bamboo mat. Slice into 8 pieces and serve with soy sauce.

Japanese.title: Ramen Tonkotsu
Japanese.instructions: Simmer pork bones in water for 8 hours to make rich broth. Strain and season with soy sauce, mirin, and sake. Cook pork belly in broth until tender. Boil eggs for 6 minutes, then marinate in soy sauce. Cook ramen noodles according to package. Assemble bowls with noodles, broth, sliced pork, soft-boiled eggs, green onions, bamboo shoots, and bean sprouts.

Japanese.title: Teriyaki Chicken
Japanese.instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, honey, ginger, and garlic to make teriyaki sauce. Heat oil in a large pan and brown chicken thighs on both sides. Add teriyaki sauce and simmer for 20 minutes, turning chicken occasionally. Increase heat to reduce sauce until thickened and glossy. Garnish with sesame seeds and serve with rice.

Japanese.title: Tempura Shrimp
Japanese.instructions: Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tail intact. Mix tempura flour with ice-cold water and egg yolk to make batter. Heat oil to 350°F. Dust shrimp with cornstarch, dip in batter, and fry until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tempura sauce and grated daikon radish.

Japanese.title: Miso Soup
Japanese.instructions: Bring dashi stock to a gentle simmer. Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of hot stock, then add to pot. Add wakame seaweed and simmer for 2 minutes. Carefully add tofu cubes and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and ladle into bowls. Garnish with green onions, bonito flakes, and nori pieces.

Japanese.title: Beef Sukiyaki
Japanese.instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar to make sukiyaki sauce. Heat a large skillet and add sauce. Add beef slices and cook until browned. Add vegetables and noodles, cooking until vegetables are tender. Crack eggs into small bowls for dipping. Serve hot with raw eggs for dipping.

Japanese.title: Chicken Katsu
Japanese.instructions: Pound chicken breasts to even thickness. Season with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs. Heat oil to 350°F and fry chicken until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Slice and serve with tonkatsu sauce, shredded cabbage, and lemon wedges.

Japanese.title: Gyoza Dumplings
ingredients: Soy sauce and rice vinegar for dipping
Japanese.instructions: Mix pork, cabbage, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper for filling. Place small amount of filling in center of gyoza wrapper. Moisten edges with water and fold to seal. Heat oil in a large pan and arrange gyoza in a single layer. Cook until bottom is golden. Add water and cover to steam for 5 minutes. Serve with soy sauce and rice vinegar.

Japanese.title: Salmon Teriyaki
Japanese.instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, honey, ginger, and garlic to make teriyaki sauce. Heat oil in a large pan and sear salmon fillets skin-side down for 3 minutes. Flip and cook for 2 minutes. Add teriyaki sauce and simmer for 5 minutes, basting salmon with sauce. Garnish with sesame seeds and serve with rice.

Japanese.title: Onigiri Rice Balls
Japanese.instructions: Cook sushi rice and mix with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Let cool to room temperature. Wet hands with water and salt. Take a handful of rice and form into a triangle shape. Make a small indentation and add filling (salmon, tuna, or pickled plum). Wrap with nori strip and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
